attributes.action: Is Cameron fit to be Prime Minister as he lied re not cutting child tax credits.
attributes.additional_details: The Leaders Special is available on You Tube, search for 'Question Time: Election Leaders Special'. David Cameron deliberately misled the British public over the Conservative Party's intension to cut child tax credits if elected. As he made such a deliberate misrepresentation on a critical issue, he is not fit to be Prime Minister.
attributes.background: On 30 April 2015, in the Leaders Special, David Dimbleby asked David Cameron to confirm that 'absolutely... as a guarantee... child tax credit will not fall'. Cameron responded: 'we've increased child tax credit by £450' and 'child tax credit is NOT going to fall'. This was a blatant lie to mislead.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept duplicate petitions. We think this petition is similar to yours: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/104471

You might like to sign this petition instead. It is more likely to get more signatures that way.
